body:
I'm not sure why this line changed the way it did. Otherwise looks great. 

Do you want to add dist to gitignore in this pr too?
Curious why you didn't use the src variable here?
What if you move all S3 related code down to the same code block? Would be nice to keep it in one place. Or could these vars be moved to secrets?
@leemunroe I was going to do that at first but decided against it for a reason I now forget. I've moved it to the secrets file. I blame it on late night coding :)
Should this be replaced with grunt-aws-s3?
I think we want to use the new vars here <%= paths.dist %>
Yep, must've gotten messed up during rebase. Fixed.
I was trying to test this out and `test/` was tripping me up. Does this need to be here?
No, it shouldn't be there. I actually made a modification just now to allow for subdirectories within the bucket (or it can be left blank to use the bucket at the main directory).
Looks like bucketuri is used here but bucketpath in the readme/secrets.json
Can we remove line 344? I think these are duplicates if I'm not mistaken.

Only if you want less browser coverage. Not recommended.
Unless there's actual bugs / issues, i'd recommend going through with the PR and we can enhance later as needed.
Autoprefixer is only used for the preview server though (grunt serve) right?

Sorry just noticed this. Is there a reason we're using a btn class here? Assuming it was copied over from another component file? I think for the purposes of the chart, we can change this to be just one table and give it a different class e.g. ```
Thoughts? ```
